title: (x) Park Community Church logo - custom designed (based on Bell Gothic) {Naoise Ó Conchubhair}
content:
I found this website with some really clean identity work.

Can anyone identify the typeface used for PARK? Caught my eye immediately and now I need to know.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [park logo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/typophile.com/files/park%20logo.png) | 15.75 KB |

 [‹ "American" copperplate-style connected script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47989 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Fastack logo slanted square strict geometric sans - Beast Machines {Ignacio} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47966 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bjk

comments.content: This is custom fiddling with a base font.
I didn’t think that a church logo could be this stylish.

I didn’t think so either. They really did a great job with it. I’m trying to find the agency that did all the work.

The website was done really well too.

[http://www.parkcommunitychurch.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/www.parkcommunitychurch.org/)
Got it! It’s a custom job based on [Bell Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/bell_gothic_bold/?sample_text=PARK).

This will interest you Ben it’s the full story of the logo : [http://timschraeder.typepad.com/cr8ve/2008/06/communication-revoltion-pa...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122014638/http:/timschraeder.typepad.com/cr8ve/2008/06/communication-revoltion-part-2-logos.html "http://timschraeder.typepad.com/cr8ve/2008/06/communication-revoltion-part-2-logos.html"). You’d swear I was working for this church!

Interesting indeed. I wasn’t expecting to find all that!

It is fun to read the behind the scenes for this type of work.

Thanks again, Naoiseo!

Ben

Hey guys!

Sorry for hijacking the convo here... I am the guy partly responsible for all this! I directed the creation of our logo and am on staff at Park!

Glad to see that our logo caught your eye... how did you find it?

Hi Tim,

I found your site on churchbeauty.com

Your designers did a great job. Likewise you did a great job of not settling for a logo and tweaking it until perfect.
I found you’re blog through detective work Tim! Your name is in the meta data of a PDF I found on the church website and I then did some creative googling.
